com.mewna.catnip.shard.manager

Interface ShardManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractShardManager, DefaultShardManager

    public interface ShardManager
    Manages the lifecycle of shards - starting, stopping, resuming, etc.
    Since:
    8/15/18.
    Author:
    amy

      • latency

        @Nonnull
java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Long> latency(@Nonnegative
                                                                        int shard)
        Return the shard's computed gateway latency, ie. the time it takes for the shard to send a heartbeat to Discord and get a response.
        Parameters:
        shard - The shard ID to get gateway latency for.
        Returns:
        The shard's computed gateway latency.

      • isConnected

        @Nonnull
 @CheckReturnValue
java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> isConnected(@Nonnegative
                                                                                                  int id)
        Checks whether or not the shard with the given ID is currently connected to the websocket gateway. This is done as a boolean because - at least for now - there's only 2 meaningful states: connected, and queued to be connected.

        If the shard id does not exist (ex. not controlled by this shard manager instance), then the future will FAIL, and this case must also be handled.

        This is fetched asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the shard to get connection status for.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the shard with the given id is currently connected to the websocket gateway.

      • catnip

        @Nonnull
Catnip catnip()
